q: I told you so. According to this new report from right-wing reactionaries at The Guardian(`` Holocaust denier in charge of handling Moscow cables''), it is slightly worse than I suspected. At Ellingham Hall, the Norfolk country house where he is staying while on bail, Julian Paul Assange was seen handing over batches of them to visiting foreign journalists, including someone who was simply introduced as`` Adam .`` He seemed like a harmless old man,'' said one staffer,`` apart from his habit of standing too close and peering at what was written on your screen.'' Julian Paul Assange was seen handing over batches of them to visiting foreign journalists, including someone who was simply introduced as`` Adam''.`` He seemed like a harmless old man,'' said one staffer, apart from his habit of standing too close and peering at what was written on your screen. He was introduced as the father of Julian Paul Assange 's Swedish crony, journalist Johannes WahlstrÃ¶m, and took away copies of cables from Russia and post-Soviet states. had`` confirmed the existence of the Belarus dossier''. According to him, WikiLeaks had several thousand`` interesting'' secret documents. Israel Schamir then wrote a piece of grovelling pro-Lukashenko propaganda in Counterpunch, claiming the people were happy, fully employed, and satisfied with their government . justice'' if he is extradited to Sweden over sex crimes allegations. Julian Paul Assange lawyer Geoffrey Ronald Robertson said his client was fighting extradition because such trials are usually held in secret. A trial behind closed doors would be a flagrant denial of justice... blatantly unfair, not only by British standards but by European standards and indeed by international standards, he said.`` You can not have a fair trial where the press and the public are excluded from the court,'' Geoffrey Ronald Robertson said. secret. A trial behind closed doors would be`` a flagrant denial of justice... blatantly unfair, not only by British standards but by European standards and indeed by international standards,'' he said. You can not have a fair trial where the press and the public are excluded from the court, Geoffrey Ronald Robertson said. The detention hearings in the case in Sweden so far have been held behind closed doors. Julian Paul Assange is accused of sexual misconduct by two women he met during a visit to Stockholm

a trove of leaked diplomatic cables and secret U.S. military files. Julian Paul Assange 's lawyers claim the Swedish prosecution is linked to the leaks and politically motivated. Preliminary defense arguments released by Julian Paul Assange 's legal team claim there is a real risk that, if extradited to Sweden, the U.S. will seek his extradition and/or illegal rendition to the USA, where there will be a real risk of him being detained at Guantanamo Bay or elsewhere. The document adds that`` there is a real risk that he could be made subject to the death penalty'' if sent to the United States. Under European law, suspects can not be extradited to

to Sweden, the U.S. will seek his extradition and/or illegal rendition to the USA, where there will be a real risk of him being detained at Guantanamo Bay or elsewhere.'' The document adds that there is a real risk that he could be made subject to the death penalty if sent to the United States. Under European law, suspects can not be extradited to jurisdictions where they may face execution. Julian Paul Assange , wearing a blue suit, was flanked by two prison guards as

at Belmarsh Magistrates' Court. Celebrity supporters Jemima Marcelle Goldsmith and Bianca Perez Moreno De Macias also attended. Geoffrey Ronald Robertson denied Julian Paul Assange had committed any sexual offenses in English law. He said all relationships, long or short, contain moments of frustration, irritation and argument. This doesn't mean, in this country, that the police are entitled to sniff under the bedclothes. , forcing polar bears during the fall open-water periods to either forage from shore or swim longer distances in search of sea ice. Bears that retreat to land usually find little or no food there, and typically... spend the duration fasting while they await the re-formation of ice needed to access and hunt seals, according to a 2008 government study. Conservation groups, the state of Sarah Louise Heath Palin , the Sarah Louise Heath Palin Oil and Gas Assn. and several other groups are locked in litigation in Washington, D.C., over polar bear protections
